name: Espíritu Santo
excerpt: A treasure trove of shallow azure inlets and sorbet-pink cliffs, Espíritu Santo is one of La Paz’s gems. It’s part of a Unesco World Heritage site…

name: Santuario de la Virgen de Guadalupe
excerpt: La Paz’ largest religious monument; its 12m-tall altar is grandiose.

name: Unidad Cultural Profesor Jesús Castro Agúndez
excerpt: The Teatro de la Ciudad, part of this large cultural center, is the main performance venue in La Paz.

name: Biblioteca de la Historia de las Californias
excerpt: Across from the Jardín Velasco, La Paz’s former Casa de Gobierno is now the Biblioteca de la Historia de las Californias, a history library.

name: Museo Regional de Antropología e Historia
excerpt: This is a large, well-organized museum chronicling the peninsula’s history (in Spanish) from prehistory to the Revolution of 1910 and its aftermath.

name: Playa Balandra
excerpt: The most beautiful in a series of beaches north of La Paz, Playa Balandra is an enclosed cove with shallow azure water that's great for toddlers. Kayaks…

name: Malecón
excerpt: La Paz's waterfront, with its wide sidewalk, tiny beaches, tourist pier, benches, sculptures by local artists and unimpeded sunset views, is the city's…
